org.openremote.java.console.controller.connector

Class SingleThreadHttpConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openremote.java.console.controller.connector.SingleThreadHttpConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControllerConnector

    public class SingleThreadHttpConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Test controller connector that does things synchronously for ease of testing
    Author:
    Richard Turner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SingleThreadHttpConnector() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback, int timeout)
      Connects to the controller and maintains the connection; it is the connectors responsibility to notify the caller via the callback onFailure method when the connection closes for some reason
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the controller; does nothing if not already connected
      java.lang.String getControllerIdentity()
      Gets the unique controller identity
      java.net.URL getControllerUrl()
      Gets the controller URL
      Credentials getCredentials()
      Returns the currently active credentials
      void getPanel(java.lang.String panelName, org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<org.openremote.entities.panel.version1.Panel> callback, int timeout)
      Returns org.openremote.web.console.panel.Panel definition of the specified panel.
      void getPanelInfo(org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.List<org.openremote.entities.panel.PanelInfo>> callback, int timeout)
      Returns java.util.List of panels that are recognised by this controller.
      void getResource(org.openremote.entities.panel.ResourceLocator resourceLocator, java.lang.String resourceName, boolean getData, org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<org.openremote.entities.panel.ResourceInfo> callback, int timeout)
      Get the resource info for the requested resource optionally retrieve the data of the resource (otherwise lazy load)
      void getResourceData(java.lang.String resourceName, org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<org.openremote.entities.panel.ResourceDataResponse> callback, int timeout)
      Get the data for the requested resource
      void getSensorValues(int[] sensorIds, org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback, int timeout)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values.
      boolean isConnected()
      Indicates if the connector is currently connected to the controller
      boolean isDiscoveryRunning()
      Determines if controller discovery is currently running
      void logout(org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback, int timeout)
      Logs out of the controller.
      void monitorSensors(int[] sensorIds, org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback, int timeout)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values only for sensors whose values have changed since the last request.
      void sendCommand(org.openremote.entities.panel.PanelCommand command, org.openremote.entities.controller.AsyncControllerCallback<org.openremote.entities.panel.PanelCommandResponse> callback, int timeout)
      Returns Boolean indicating whether command send request was successful.
      void setControllerUrl(java.net.URL controllerUrl)
      Sets the controller URL
      void setCredentials(Credentials credentials)
      Sets the org.openremote.java.controller.auth.Credentials to be used by this connector
      void startDiscovery(AsyncControllerDiscoveryCallback callback, int tcpPort, java.lang.Integer searchDuration)
      Perform controller discovery for the specified period of time using the specified TCP port and call onDiscoveryStarted, if discovery cannot be started then call onStartDiscoveryFailed.
      void stopDiscovery()
      Stop current controller discovery and call onDiscoveryStopped of callback provided at startDiscovery

      • startDiscovery

        public void startDiscovery(AsyncControllerDiscoveryCallback callback,
                  int tcpPort,
                  java.lang.Integer searchDuration)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerConnector
        Perform controller discovery for the specified period of time using the specified TCP port and call onDiscoveryStarted, if discovery cannot be started then call onStartDiscoveryFailed. When a new controller is discovered call onControllerFound.
        Specified by:
        startDiscovery in interface ControllerConnector
